Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • Game

  • public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that controls and implements a game of Rock, Paper, Scissors, Lizard, Spock

    • Field Summary

      used for clarity, represents the number of users + the one bot.

    • Field Detail

      • players

        private PlayerForGame[] players
        Creates an array of players, the first position is always the Bot and the remaining are the various users. Currently implementation is hard set for 1 human and the bot but game is set up to be able to allow more

      • botPlayer

        private Player_Bot botPlayer
        controls the bot's game choices since the bot isn't a sentient being

      • allMoves

        private MOVE[] allMoves
        stores the moves for all players. Only contains the moves of the current turn

      • status

        private PLAYER_STATUS[] status
        used to keep track of if players have been eliminated, are still playing, or and the winner

      • totalPlayers

        private int totalPlayers
        used for clarity, represents the number of users + the one bot. Using this field you could potentially choose to have multiple bots in each game but current code only has 1 bot

      • WHO_BEATS_WHO

        private static final int[][] WHO_BEATS_WHO
        Static array that helps the program determine which moves beat and loose to which other moves. Each row contains the relationships for a single move. The numbers in that row are 1 if the move in that column looses to it, -1 if the row's move looses to the move in that column, and 0 when it matches with itself. This is a numerical representation of the string print out showed in the 'showGameRules()' method

    • Constructor Detail

      • Game

        public Game(int numPlayers)
        Constructor that takes in how many players (other than the bot). The number of players could be determined based on how many players are in the server channel or could be determined based on which players actually want to play
        Parameters:
        numPlayers - number of human players

    • Method Detail

      • gameTurn

        public void gameTurn(java.lang.String humanMove)
        The logic that occurs after all players choose their move
        Parameters:
        humanMove - string representation of the player's move

      • getStatus

        public PLAYER_STATUS[] getStatus()
        get method used to allow another class to access this field
        Returns:
        array housing the status of each player

      • checkMovePair

        private static int checkMovePair(java.lang.String first,
                                 java.lang.String second)
        Takes in the current players move and also the move of another player and returns the win/lose/tie result from the pair. Done this way because the result is different from each player's point of view. Example player1: rock and player2: paper. Since paper covers rock the result is 1 from player2 perspective but -1 from player1 perspective
        Parameters:
        first - move from current player's perspective
        second - move made by player that isn't the current player
        Returns:
        result from current player's perspective

      • resultsToShow

        public java.lang.String resultsToShow()
        Class that computes the output displayed to the current GUI implementation of the game. Geared specifically for 1 computer player and 1 human player
        Returns:
        string that will get printed out to the user's GUI of the game

      • showGameRules

        public void showGameRules()
        Simple print out so players know which moves conquer over others. not currently used but useful if choose to expand the current implementation
